text: An <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent pathway of DNA damage - induced apoptosis in mitogen - activated T lymphocytes .

Lymphocytes are particularly susceptible to DNA damage - induced apoptosis , a response which may serve as a form of 'altruistic suicide ' to counter their intrinsic high potential for mutation and clonal expansion .

The tumour suppressor <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been shown to regulate this type of apoptosis in thymocytes , but an as yet unknown , <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent pathway ( s ) appears to mediate the same event in mitogen - activated mature T lymphocytes .

Here we show DNA damage - induced apoptosis in these T lymphocytes is dependent on the antioncogenic transcription factor <extra_id_0> interferon regulatory factor (IRF)-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Thus two different anti-onco-genic transcription factors , <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , are required for distinct apoptotic pathways in T lymphocytes .

We also show that mitogen induction of the <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta converting enzyme <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ICE <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene , a mammalian homologue of the Caenorhabditis elegans cell death gene <extra_id_0> ced-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , is <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent .
